channel.title: Cult In The Jungle Republic 3 - Rerolling in a New Thread
channel.description:
# Welcome to Cult in the Jungle Republic 3!
This is a multiball setup where the mafia and the cult must compete against each other to win. ## Mechanics Were back to mostly the same ruleset from CITJR 2, but with three differences: • Days last 72 hours, and nights last 24 hours. • Lynch is majority **and plurality**. There is no day one lynch, and day one ends when all players have confirmed. **No lynching is not an option.** • Both the mafia and the cult have a **day &** night chat. • Cultists win 1v1v1 scenarios, and equal numbered mafia and cult with no townies scenarios. • There are no wills/journals. ### Night Actions Order • The **[color=lime]Cop[/color]** investigates their target, finding out if they are a member of **[color=red]The Mafia[/color]** or not. • The night kill targets of the **[color=lime]Anytime Vigilante[/color]** and/or **[color=red]The Mafia[/color]** become immune to being recruited by the cult. • A **[color=magenta]Cultist[/color]** attempts to recruit their target. It will only succeed if they are a **[color=lime]Citizen[/color]** that is *not* the target of a night kill. • The targets of the **[color=lime]Anytime Vigilante[/color]** and/or **[color=red]The Mafia[/color]** are killed. ## Rolelist **[color=red]Mafia Goon[/color] x4** **[color=magenta]Cultist[/color]** **[color=lime]Cop[/color]** **[color=lime]Anytime Vigilante[/color]** **[color=lime]Citizen[/color] x12** ## Role Cards > ## [color=red]Mafia Goon[/color] > **Loyal (Passive)** - You can't be recruited into the cult. **Factional Kill (Night)** - Each night phase, a mafia member may perform the factional kill. The player you target is immune to being recruited by the cult. *You win when a majority of the living players are mafia, or when nothing can prevent this from happening.* > ## [color=magenta]Cultist[/color] > **Recruit (Night)** - The Cult may recruit a player at night. You may only recruit citizens. If you recruit anyone else or a nightkill target, your recruit will fail. There can only ever be at most four cultists, including dead cultists. *You win when a majority of the living players are cultists, or when nothing can prevent this from happening.* > ## [color=lime]Cop[/color] > **Loyal (Passive)** - You can not be recruited into the cult. **Investigate (Night)** - Each night phase, you may investigate one player. You will get results back in the form of Mafia/Not Mafia (Cultists appear as Not Mafia). *You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town player alive.* > ## [color=lime]Anytime Vigilante[/color] > **Loyal (Passive)** - You can not be recruited into the cult. **Shoot (Day/Night)** - Once per day/night cycle, you may kill a player. A day/night cycle is determined by the number in Day or Night. For instance, Day 2 and Night 2 are in the same day/night cycle. Night 2 and Day 3 are in different day/night cycles. You can not kill a player on Day 1. The player you target is immune to being recruited by the cult. *You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town player alive.* > ## [color=lime]Citizen[/color] > Your weapon is your vote. You have no night actions. *You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town player alive.* # Player List: 1. **Marcus** 2. **Sam17z** 3. **Noz_Bugz** 4. Mercenary - Died N1 - **[color=limegreen]Mercenary (Citizen)[/color]** 5. **Alice** 6. **Firekitten** 7. **Luxy** 8. **WazzaAzza** 9. **PoisonedSquid** 10. Geyde - Died N1 - **[color=limegreen] ＥＮＥＭＹ **「ＳＴＡＮＤ」** (Citizen)[/color]** 11. **Wolfy** 12. **ChibiBear** 13. **Mathblade** 14. **Marluxion** 15. **htm** 16. **overthebin** 17. **Livicus** 18. **bazingaboy** 19. **hjasik** # Spectators: 1. Boss110 2. GamerPoke 3. AnonymousUsual 4. Twil1ight 5. Nerbins 6. Shurian # Backups: 1. MaximusPrime 2. Captain # Blacklist: Margaret, PKR.

item.title: Cult In The Jungle Republic 3 - Rerolling in a New Thread
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Also I had this copy and pasted then I went asleep

@PoisonedSquid I knew you were cop the whole time. I was trying to make you suspicious so mafia thinks they had a chance of mislynching you at lyio and no one would listen to you, hence me saying htm was clear.

I’m sorry if you were offended, I kept trying to hint it at you and that’s why I didn’t want to lynch you.

There was zero reasoning I could of added which is why I simply just refused to answer it, that’s why I said “if you were cop here’s a list” hoping you would understand yet you didn’t.

It’s why I kept asking if there was a nicer way to do it and that’s why I asked math. I didn’t mean to actually offend you and @Noz_Bugz it has nothing to do with ego it had something to do with keeping the cop alive so shut up. That was really rude for you to say

I knew math was actually a PR, I Town read marl so I said vigilante to shoot em that he is probably mafia, so he wouldn’t die to mafia. And I had to get the attention away from math, as I realized earlier Baz tried to convert him so I put the warnings to ignore whatever Baz said early.

I had to purposely act scummy to try to save the PR’s role however I did it rudely cause I didn’t know how to actually do it otherwise. Hence, it being a chess game. I had to think steps ahead.

Luxy being ignorant to what was happening and livicus as well made me Town read you, however you were certainly defeating my efforts at saving the PR’s.

Also that’s what Alice meant at y’all playing tic tac toe. It was like we were playing a different game then y’all were. It was fun, (annoying squid wasn’t though)

Also why I said if marl flips town from the vig shot lynch me, math wasn’t going to shoot marl there therefore I knew I was safe.

Read full topic
